title: Forced Reset After Each Update
content: After every update, my Fire Fox browser tells me that the version I used isn't supported anymore, forcing me to open a new browser. I lose everything! It's Fire Fox, which sucks because I loved using this browser.

title: Chyba zabezpečeného spojení
content:
Dobrý den, již roky používá Firefox jako oblíbený prohlížeč, nyní s ním mám problémy, protože mi při otevírání jakékoliv stránky hlásí

Chyba zabezpečeného spojení

Při spojení s www.seznam.cz nastala chyba. PR_CONNECT_RESET_ERROR 

   Požadovanou stránku nelze zobrazit, protože nelze ověřit autenticitu přijatých dat.    Kontaktujte prosím vlastníky webového serveru a informujte je o tomto problému.

Zkoušel jsem odinstalovat prohlížet a nainstalovat nový, přenastavit ho dle rad z internetu, ale nic nepomáhá. Mám v tomto prohlížeči uchováno mnoho odkazů a dále bych ho chtěl používat, můžete mi poradit, co s tím mám dělat? Zdraví Jiří Meixner

title: Bookmark suggestions in URL bar: can I get suggestions only for exact URLs?
content:
In Settings, I have configured "When using the address bar, suggest..." to use my Bookmarks, and nothing else.

Let's say I have a bookmark for the URL: https://www.mozilla.org/en-GB/firefox/products/

If I start typing "moz", that bookmark appears in the suggestions, but the autocomplete also offers me the domain's "home" URL, https://www.mozilla.org.

I don't have that "home" URL bookmarked, so I don't want it to be suggested to me - as I told Firefox when I set "Bookmarks" as the only source of suggestions. Often when trying to navigate quickly to a bookmarked page, I assume that autocomplete will be giving me my bookmarked page, and end up accidentally going to the "home URL" instead.

So is there a setting that lets me keep my bookmark suggestions, but disable this "autocomplete with home URL" behaviour?

This isn't specific to mozilla.org: that URL was just an example. However it does seem to be sensitive to addresses starting with "www". If I don't have any "www.mozilla.org/..." bookmarks but I do have some "support.mozilla.org/..." bookmarks, then I don't get the unwanted autocomplete.
creator: pg_78

title: Printing issue's
content:
Hello,

Recently when we print using firefox as our browser it is corrupting the header and footer on our letters and invoices to a larger scale e.g. 400%. We have tried using chrome and we dont have the same issues, it works perfectly. We would prefer to use firefox due to the security settings, so we would love to resolve this issue. We have reset and wiped our Mac and reinstalled all of our drivers and software (including firefox) and we are still having the same issue across all of our computers.

Our number is 0404220530, we would appreciate your help!

title: Outlook Notifications
content:
I have recently set Outlook Mail to send desktop notifications when email is received. This works when the setting is on. I would be grateful if you can advise me of anything I can do to ensure that when I change a setting/preference in FF that it stays changed until I select a different setting myself. In the case of email it is important as may miss something important. Thank you,

Steven Kiernan

title: local .htm site  - .jpg not loading via javascript
content: One of the functions of our website is a local download of a portion of the site. When downloaded an .htm file (and its companion directory) are downloaded. When the .htm file is loaded, a .jpg file should correctly load via javascript. It no longer works in Firefox but it does work in Chrome and Edge. Screenshot 1 and 2 show it working in Edge and Chrome, 3 shows it not loading in Firefox. Does anyone have any ideas on why this can be happening? I've already tried Troubleshooting mode, new profile, different computer - nothing seems to be working.
